benchmark_details.name: EventSTR
benchmark_details.overview: EventSTR is a large-scale benchmark dataset for event stream based scene text recognition, containing 9,928 high-definition event samples involving both Chinese and English characters. It was constructed to address challenging factors such as low illumination, motion blur, and cluttered backgrounds.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To introduce a novel event-based scene text recognition task and to provide a benchmark dataset for evaluating various scene text recognition algorithms.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The model heavily relies on a large-scale pre-trained LLM, which demands significant computational resources, making it less suitable for real-time applications.

data.source: Event samples collected using the Prophesee HD event camera.
data.annotation: Annotated to identify all characters occurring in the scene, matching the text as it appears.

methods: Baseline comparisons with multiple state-of-the-art scene text recognition algorithms.
methodology.calculation: BLEU scores are calculated by segmenting characters for Chinese text and by words (case-insensitive) for English text.
methodology.interpretation: Higher BLEU scores indicate better performance in accurately recognizing text.
methodology.baseline_results: SimC-ESTR achieved BLEU scores of 0.638, 0.583, 0.500, and 0.430 for BLEU-1, BLEU-2, BLEU-3, and BLEU-4 respectively.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted on the EventSTR dataset and comparisons with other benchmarks.
